alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 7:02AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A low pressure system sitting just off the coastline is bringing strong southerly winds and moderate rainfall to Santa Cruz, Santa Clara, and San Mateo counties Tuesday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.15 and 0.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.15 to 0.30 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, San Francisco, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Daly City, Mountain View, Milpitas, Palo Alto, South San Francisco, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Watsonville, Gilroy, San Bruno, Campbell, Morgan Hill, Pacifica, Saratoga, Los Gatos and Los Altos. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
